channel.title: Data | Code | Experiments
channel.description: I'm a data analyst, experiment designer, and budding programmer.

item.title: Initializing a New Data Project Directory
item.description:
A while ago I read an essay about code and data management targeted at social scientists. As a recovering social scientist, Iâ€™m guilty of the lax practices they describe.

They recommend (among other things) that project directories be built around /build and /analysis directories, and that each should have an /input, /output, /temp/, and /code directory, along with a run_directory.sh (or .py) script to ensure that the code is fully automated and replicable.

Of course, manually entering eight mkdir commands was a little annoying, so I wrote this script that automates the process of initializing a new project directory system. You can get it here. Enjoy!
